relation: Categories
Campus Safety
Greek Life
Clubs and Activities
Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
What to do for fun
Food and Dining
Dorm Life
Academic Rigor
Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments
Public Safety is on duty 24/7. There are on campus telephones you can use to call if needed.
There is not much Greek Life on campus but our neighboring Cornell university offers Greek Life. Ithaca students are welcomed to join.
There are thousands of clubs to choose from, the club fair brings them all under one roof to pick and choose from.
Students who don't like big campuses or crowds.
The Ithaca fountains are a key landmark which are beautiful in the night. There's a pond which is a great place to picnic.
There are plenty of things to do for fun. For example going into the town or the mall. When the weather's nice it's beautiful to go to the Gorges, which is almost like the Ithaca waterfalls.
There are three major dinning halls which offer different meals every night as well as outside places to order food.
There are special dorms and activities just for freshmen to allow them to become apart of the Ithaca community.
The level of difficulty of course work is dependent on your major. All courses are designed to challenge a student to their full potential.
For incoming or considering students, prepare to work to your full extent. Ithaca is a private college which takes it's academics and student achievements seriously. Ithaca is also a warming campus.

Ithaca College is a well rounded school. It challenges it's students academically and prepares them for the outside world. Not only are you exposed to academic higher learning but extracurricular aspects as well.
pageTitle: Ithaca College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {47302=The weather could be alot better but the atmosphere and the accpetence I feel here is amazing! Every one is friendly and helpful. The view is gorgeous! So everyone should definitely get a Ithaca is Gorges because it is so true. The gorges are great and as a right of passage one must go gorge jumping. Although, I do have to warn you, the waters kinda cold even in September., 25988=Here is my biggest problem with the school, this year (2009-2010) the school overenrolled about 25% more students then the school could accomidate for. All of the lounges were turned into bedroom so there is no where to just hang out or meet people on campus. And honestly there isn't much to do on campus, there are a few clubs you could join but There aren't that many to choose from., 67420=Ithaca over-accepted in 2009 but the staff and faculty work non-stop to accommodate and entertain the extra people. I love the diverse campus where film students, music majors, drama and journalism kids can all be best friends and learn from each other. Downtown Ithaca is also a perfect place for college kids to shop, eat, and explore, while still feeling the close-knit community., 200200=I have been looking forward to coming to Ithaca College since the 9th grade and when I finally came to visit this past April, it was everything that I had hoped for and more! I am applying in the fall and I hope that I get accepted. I'm so excited!, 354687=Dorms are clean and cozy, if relatively small. Freshman housing is taking over more and more of campus now, and past sophomore year you can't live in a double anymore, but other than that the dorms are nice. There is dedicated WIFI for the dorms that was upgraded in Spring 2013, but it still can be rather slow during peak hours (early evenings, typically)., 80051=I know this is generic advice, but get involved with as much as you can. There is so much to do and see around Ithaca and over 200 clubs and activities that allow you to experience that. Ithaca has pretty unpredictable weather. Since I've been there, there has been snow is September and sun in January. You really want to make sure you're prepared for those days when its 30 degrees and raining and then suddenly its 50 degrees and sunny. There is so much to get involved in, not only the school, but the town itself. If you don't get work study, get a job off campus. I volunteer at an animal shelter only 15 minutes away from the school. There are so many festivals and events downtown, so make sure you don't spend all your time on campus. Don't be afraid to take a class you don't know anything about. I know nothing about computers but I am getting ready to take a 3D animation programming class next semester and I couldn't be more excited! Ithaca has so many different fields, it's impossible to not want to try them all., 385705=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 16508=Ithaca offers the top-notch programs in each of its schools and disciplines. Job placement is also very high after graduation and many students also go on to graduate school. The price is high as it is a private school, but IC offers many resources and opportunities for students, including the Fitness Center, the new Athletic and Events Center that will be completed by 2011, and the library. Also, the college offers the chance for students to work on campus., 894=Get to know your professors, they want you to succeed and they will help you with everything. They really get to know you so take advantage of that. Visit in the winter, it gets cold and snowy. The first time I went up to Ithaca in February of 07 there was about 3 feet of snow (no lie) on the ground. Expect a lot of that! Its not as bad as everyone thinks. It snows in the morning and its warmer by the afternoon. Also, explore the town, its full of a lot of little surprises. Ithaca is all about community, if you like chill people, Ithaca is the school for you.}

textAfterTable: Courtney from Yorktown Heights, NY 01/13/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 15 out of 15 people found this review useful. 3 of 86 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Are you creative, intelligent, friendly, unique, and want the chance to experience something new or be attend a school that makes you feel comfortable to be who you are? Then you are a Ithaca student. Everyone here is unique and friendly; its hard not to make friends. I know going away from home may be scary especially if you enter into college not knowing anybody, but attending Ithaca makes you feel right at home and makes the transition from high school to college really easy and pain free. If you want to the full college experience then you should be a Ithaca College student! Tips for prospective students Ithaca is a great place to be and if you decide to attend that take advantage of all these great opportunities. Take a class that sounds any bit interesting to you, join a team or club if is about something you like to do, be part
